channel.title: sudo apt update - "NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48"
channel.description:
Hey all -
I've installed Monero on Ubuntu through Whonix's repository, but as of late my `sudo apt update` has been giving me the following error:
``` The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48 ```
How can I fix this? I see https://forums.whonix.org/t/apt-gpg-error-signature-could-not-be-verified/31 from 2014 where @Patrick said he had to update his key, but I'm not sure if it's the same issue.
Can provide more info as needed, not sure what else could be helpful at this stage though.

item.title: sudo apt update - "NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48"
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
A post was split to a new topic: Err:11 https://deb.whonix.org buster InRelease - signatures couldn’t be verified because the public key is not available:

Read full topic

item.title: sudo apt update - "NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48"
item.dc:creator: dginovker
item.description:
Thanks, looks like it’s working now. If it ever happens again I’ll make a new post

Read full topic

item.description:
Hey all -

I’ve installed Monero on Ubuntu through Whonix’s repository, but as of late my sudo apt update has been giving me the following error:

The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available: NO_PUBKEY CB8D50BB77BB3C48

How can I fix this? I see Apt GPG error - signature could not be verified from 2014 where @Patrick said he had to update his key, but I’m not sure if it’s the same issue.

Can provide more info as needed, not sure what else could be helpful at this stage though.
